articles.title: ECMAScript 6 Schedule Changes

snippet.text: Allen Wirfs-Brock, editor of the ECMAScript 6 specification, recently mentioned on Twitter that the schedule for ES6 has changed slightly. Formal publication of the ES6 standard is now due in June 2015

articles.title: JSConf EU 2014 Call for Speakers

snippet.text: Closes June 20th. Is in Berlin, Sep 13-14

articles.title: Easy 3D-Accelerated Games in A Browser with JavaScript and WebGL using Three.js or Babylon.js

snippet.text: It’s always good to see Scott excited about something as he shares his insights so well, and 3D accelerated graphics in the browser is an increasingly important use case for JavaScript

articles.title: Submit a Talk to Speak at 'Powered by JavaScript' at Strange Loop

snippet.text: The popular Strange Loop developer conference is co-hosting a one-day Powered by JavaScript JavaScript event on September 17. If you want to speak, get your proposal in ASAP

articles.title: AngularJS 101: From Zero to Angular in Seconds

snippet.text: How to build realtime into your AngularJS app in just 99 lines of HTML and JavaScript

articles.title: SIMD in JavaScript

snippet.text: Intel Open Source Technology Center

articles.title: Tutorial: Real-Time Chat With Node's Readline and Socket.io

snippet.text: A tutorial by Matt Harzewski on using Node's readline module to create a powerful(ish) terminal-based prompt that you can then build a chat system on top of with Node. (If you like this, be sure to check out Node Weekly

articles.title: jQuery: Using Only What You Need

snippet.text: See how you can include only the pieces of jQuery that your application needs using AMD by TJ VanToll

articles.title: Vic Ramon's Ember on Rails Tutorial

snippet.text: An introduction to the Ember JS framework in 22 chapters. It shows you how to build an Ember app with a Ruby on Rails-based backend and explains all the underlying concepts along the way

articles.title: Building a Multi-Step Form in AngularJS Using UI Router
Getting Started with Browserify

snippet.text: Browserify allows you to use Node.js style modules in the browser and Patrick Catanzariti presents a complete introduction

articles.title: Using ES6 Modules Today
Rethinking AngularJS Controllers

snippet.text: Todd shares his thoughts on a different way to look at Angular controllers, as well as some best practices

articles.title: Dependency Injection in JavaScript

snippet.text: Reflections on using dependency injection in JavaScript to manage complexity

articles.title: JavaScript as an Alternative to AppleScript on OS X Yosemite (10.10)
Why Ramda?

snippet.text: Ramda is a ‘practical functional library’ for JavaScript developers, but on the surface it can be tricky to see the benefits. This article digs into the use cases

articles.title: Refactoring JavaScript Apps Into a Framework

snippet.text: Podcast. The JavaScript Jabber crew get together with Brandon Hays to talk about frameworks and their role in building more modular JavaScript apps

articles.title: JavaScript Engineer at Pantheon (San Francisco, CA)

snippet.text: We're looking for an engineer with a passion for JavaScript to help us build the best user experience for our customers. Join our collaborative team of brainstorming developers and enjoy a role where you can own your initiatives

articles.title: JavaScript Software Developer (Madison, WI)

snippet.text: Widen Enterprises is looking for a JavaScript expert who wants to join a dynamic team, have fun, and work with great people and technology

articles.title: Boba.js: A JavaScript Library for Google Analytics

snippet.text: A small, easily extensible library to make working with Google Analytics easier. Tie together events with Google Analytics, etc

articles.title: qooxdoo 4.0 Released

snippet.text: A universal JavaScript framework covering desktop, mobile and server uses

articles.title: DHTMLX 4.0 Released: A Modern JavaScript-Based Web App UI Library
Springy.js: A Force Directed Graph Layout Algorithm in JavaScript

snippet.text: Uses physics to figure out how to show a network graph in a way that looks good

articles.title: 50 Emulators Written in JavaScript

snippet.text: Links to different JavaScript-based emulators for classic systems like the Sega Master System, ZX Spectrum, and NES

articles.title: Telerik NativeScript: A Forthcoming Framework for Building Native Mobile Applications with Pure JavaScript

snippet.text: Declare business logic and data models in JavaScript and share across all target platforms. Bring in your own third party libraries. No Mac required to compile for iOS. Not yet public but beta testers appear to be sought
